prompt: <description>**Part 1: Tall, Rectangular Prism with a Tapered Top** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with an euler angle of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. **Sketching Face 1:** Face 1 contains a single loop, loop 1, composed of the following lines and their respective start and end points: * Line 1: Start Point - [0.0, 0.0275], End Point - [0.0477, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point - [0.0477, 0.0], End Point - [0.0954, 0.0275] * Line 3: Start Point - [0.0954, 0.0275], End Point - [0.0954, 0.0826] * Line 4: Start Point - [0.0954, 0.0826], End Point - [0.0477, 0.1101] * Line 5: Start Point - [0.0477, 0.1101], End Point - [0.0, 0.0826] * Line 6: Start Point - [0.0, 0.0826], End Point - [0.0, 0.0275] **Extrusion:** The sketch must be scaled using a scaling factor of 0.1101. Extrude the sketch to a height of 0.7631 units along the positive z-axis while extruding towards the normal. **Part 2: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom** Create a new coordinate system with an euler angle of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0], and a translation vector of [-0.0478, 0.0551, 0.6974]. **Sketching Face 1:** Face 1 contains a single loop, loop 1, composed of four lines and their respective start and end points: * Line 1: Start Point - [0.0, 0.1154], End Point - [0.0026, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point - [0.0026, 0.0], End Point - [0.1807, 0.0667] * Line 3: Start Point - [0.1807, 0.0667], End Point - [0.1807, 0.1154] * Line 4: Start Point - [0.1807, 0.1154], End Point - [0.0, 0.1154] **Extrusion:** Scale the sketch with a factor 0.1807. Perform a cut extrusion with a depth of 0.0954 units in both directions along the normal. Upon completing these instructions, you will have created the desired CAD models. The first part will be a tall, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top, while the second part will be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The final assembly will result in the CAD model representing a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole running through its center.</description>

Create arc_2 starting at the endpoint of line_2 (0.0114, 0.0682) and using a midpoint at (0.0455, 0.0341), ending at the Y-coordinate of 0.0. Now, the sketch faces and loops include: - Sketch face 1 - Loop 1: circle_1 - Loop 2: line_1, arc_1, line_2, arc_2 - Loop 3: circle_2 To complete this part, you will now extrude it: Extrude the sketch in both directions: - Extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.0043 - Extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.0043 - Sketch_scale: 0.7273 This part represents a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. Provide the above instructions for each part, making sure to include all the required information for the junior designer to accurately generate the parametric CAD model.
